column5: for anyone who drives past scugog, I just wanted to know if it's frozen. Want to duck hunt on saturday morning and don't feel like waking up early and driving there to find out its frozen. There was some ice last weekend but I was still able to get around (north of the island). Thanks
it has not been below 0 in over a week  my guess would be no ice but  it does freeze fast as soon as the temps start to dip  like tomorrow....

No ice there today.  It was 15 degrees on Wednesay and has stayed above freezing.  Maybe mid next week, when temps are supposed to dip to below freezing over night and stay around 0 for daytime highs.
thanks! looks like im getting up early tommorrow
Plenty of rain falling today.
good huntin  my 2 cents  2many
Daily Scugog Ice Reports  http://forums.fishontario.com/thread.jspa;...941?  Entropy
Some skim ice south of the causeway and maybe in some quiter back bays, but not the main lake. We did get about a half inch of snow this morning.
Is it legal to icefish on Scugog river?

Yep we are about 120 feet from our dock.  The river is not open during the winter.  But where does the river and the lake end ? ......  It is a dangerous area to be (near where the river flows out) people go through every year.  Steer Clear.  Entropy
skim ice
skim ice, where?  perhaps in the shallow weedy, not so windy areas.  Hope when I get home, I'll see some too!  Entropy
Wont be long here with this cold weather

Dec 4th (Evening): Some very thin ‘slushy’ crust of ice on the surface.  (Suspected that if a gentle wind came up it would be gone)  Dec 5th  (Morning ): Some small waves, no more crust of ice. Darn waves. We need to get some thickness built up, so it does not break apart from the waves.  Decent amount of ice building up on the rocks on shore ( and my first section of dock too) Going to pull the rest of the dock out tonight.   If I don’t I suspect it will be frozen in by Sunday.  Not like I will be canoeing anymore; will wait till ice starts to go out.  Won’t be long now.  26 Days 13.75 Hours  Get Your Fish-On ! Entropy

The weather has been way to warm to even think of Heading on the ice unless you have a float tube with you. Probaly at least 2-3 weeks of colder weather.  Be safe we all loving fishing but not that much....  cheers

Dec 5 (evening): Pulled the rest of the dock out last night, had to take the spud down to free it from shore.  There was about 40 feet of ice out from shore about 1 - 2 cm thick, 3 hours later it was all gone ???? And there was only a bit of ice on shore again.  No strong wind came up..... where did it go...?  Down the road there is about 70 feet of ice out from shore, thick enough to toss some rocks out and wait for them to hit open water.  Almost enough thickness there to stand on.... or ... well maybe one foot to rest on till it broke.  All we need is a couple of cold days with no wind to get the ice started.  At lest the dock is out, (toddyfish) now I can turn my back and not be concerned.   25 Days 15.5 Hours  Entropy  Not Yet
Not looking good for ice if you believe The Weather Network....This is for Toronto.

Dec 6:      Did not check the lake.   morning of Dec 7 (this morning) did check the lake, too windy for ice to form. There was some broken chunks and slush building up on shore out to about 30 feet out from shore. TOO MUCH WIND.   I would expect the ice to be coming along in areas of the lake where there is little or no wind.   24 Days 14 Hours   Entropy
I checked the lake last night, and ICE !! for as far as I could see.   Could even walk on it for a bit. (down the road from my house)   Out in front of the dock it is too weak yet.

Dec 11 (evening) : checked the ice, there is still 2 inches, but any holes cut over the weekend are still open.  I took a chipper with me (spud) and the ice feels very soft, in fact it is taking on a ‘honeycomb’ appearance.  There is some water pooling on top of the ice. I really wonder it there will be any ice left by this weekend.  19 Days 13.5 Hours  I’ve got the canoe ready if need be.  Entropy
i'm getting the canoe and waders ready for saturday!!
Hold on...  Canoe, waders, and REALLY COLD WATER?  I really hope I don't read about you in the sunday paper...
It's lookin more and more like a green Christmas this year....not lookin good for ice!
